title: @Riot A few Questions myself about next Pre-Season
body:
I've got a few questions about what's gonna happen during the next Pre-Season so here I go:

1. How is the jungle going to be tuned now that Smite rewards are gone? Will it be slightly easier to clear? will there be more lesser creatures to kill to take care of that? (like when we saw a total of 5 birds in raptor camp)

2. With Rylai's soon to be nerfed in one of either MANY apparent directions, will mages be able to get a new item that'll at least fill the 100 AP item slot that it's leaving behind? (I think MM and I both vote for Pox Arcana and/or Netherstride Grimoire from BMB lol)

3. I keep hearing that Masteries are the next thing to be discussed next week, after the discussion about the jungle/Plants have subsided. While I can wait till then to hear **Specific** masteries, I was wondering if any new ones will help out mages :P (Hey, I gotta look out for my karthus man!)

And One Question pertaining to something not really related to Pre-Season, but I figured what the heck lol :P

BONUS: When it comes to champs with "After-Death" Passives, Both Kalista and Ryze can basically do the same stuff with their ults (As far as I know), but one weird bit is that while Kalista can Ult Karthus while he's in his passive, Ryze Can't. Doesn't it feel like a bit of inconsistency here?

replies.body:
1. Jungle camps have had some stat adjustments so that clear difficulty should be about the same as it currently is. Smite also provides healing (some flat + some missing health %) when used on Monsters, which makes up for some of the contribution that previously came from smite buffs. Some jungle camps are also shifting to be more AOE friendly (e.g. more raptors) or more single target friendly (e.g. blue/red buff no longer have mini dudes with them). The biggest motivator there is to give us a way to support different profiles of jungler (the ones that are really good at AOE, so prioritize those camps, or really good at single target so prioritize other camps). At present really effective junglers generally have pretty similar looking damage approaches.

2. We're still figuring out whether other AP item changes would be needed to adjust for any Rylai's changes. Buffing DeathCap a little is one option that's been floated around, given it's fallen off in use/effectiveness a bit more than we'd expected. 

3. Mastery changes are going to be pretty small (one replacement Keystone, significant balance changes to another Keystone or two, addition of some tier 1 and tier 2 one pointers). 

After-Death passives - Just checked and we are seeing Ryze ult transport Karthus while he's in his passive. If you're seeing otherwise that's a bug we'd want to fix - details much appreciated!

If there are AP itemization changes, I'd much rather see better tank and teamplay AP items. I'd argue Deathcap still fulfills an endgame niche _extremely_ well, with earlier purchase points on the best AP stackers. Comparatively, there's a lot of room to make an AP off-tank item that isn't just a bunch of HP and AP. Like (improvising here, might be bad) if ohmwrecker's statline also had 60 AP, and it's passive was replaced with "Gain 5 movespeed per minion within a 100 unit radius, minions within the same radius gain 15 movespeed" - AP tank tops have a way to compete with the stupidly strong phage passive, and both mid and tops get a mechanic that makes trading around minions more rewarding, and allows for stronger/faster pushing. The passive also gives the biggest boost in nexus defense scenarios, which is an area where tanks and (ap) offtanks tend to lag behind in my experience, if only due to damage dealers being massive at that point, making any CC a death sentence.

Even Moonflair Spellblade on Summoner's Rift would be an excellent addition in my opinion. Really unique stat line that would benefit users like Shen quite a lot.

Are there any plans to adjust Tracker's Knife to compensate for the removal of Smite buffs?  

I found that the ability to regularly take advantage of the Smite buffs (particularly Gromp and Raptors) without having to worry overly much about saving one for PvP or Dragon/Baron was one of the item's main advantages. 

While one could argue that having it available for healing would be an advantage, that would be far less useful after early-game finishes than the valuable buffs we are losing.

> We're still figuring out whether other AP item changes would be needed to adjust for any Rylai's changes. Buffing DeathCap a little is one option that's been floated around, given it's fallen off in use/effectiveness a bit more than we'd expected.

My take on this, is that Rylai's rose to popularity because every other item that overshadowed it was changed. Deathcap became incredibly expensive, Zhonya's is now a CDR/Utility item, Luden's was a powerhouse when released but isn't as popular anymore. In general the items that make a Mage feel like "Okay, now I'm seriously STRONG" have been demphasized and don't feel like they are there anymore. With the exception of Morellonomicon, of course, since the item provides so many stats. Maybe in the end, what the game lacks right now, is more 100 AP items and less CDR and Utility ones?

I'm sure you're getting a **lot** of questions about balance, and Rioters can get frustrated with one comment leading to a dozen other questions (give 'em an inch they'll take a mile), but there's a question that's stuck in my head for quite a while ever since you guys explained that assassins are going away from instagib and run and more towards extended burst windows and trickier plays.

And that question is about Annie.

You guys allowed Annie to keep her point and click spells- including the instant summon Tibbers- because it served as a reliable anti-assassination tool. Assassins are being made much healthier and much more capable of being outplayed, and are being given tools to allow them to do more than just kill people. But with assassins having more room to be outplayed, that makes me concerned that Annie is going to go from a means of countering asssassins to being overbearing against them.

I realize you guys have said you aren't going to be making any preemptive nerfs or buffs for the assassin class update, but do you have anything planned in case Annie turns out to be overly dominant against the new and healthier assassin playstyle? Or plans for her in general, since her update ultimately did very little to change her "drop Tibbers and 100-0" uninteractive playstyle?

>(e.g. blue/red buff no longer have mini dudes with them)

Doesn't this risk making AOE based tank junglers even weaker to invades since they can no longer really start their buffs? Seems to me like this would be a huge buff to the already overwhelming single target junglers like Lee Sin and Elise since they can change paths readily taking more important buffs than AOE junglers.

Also where would his leave Shyvana? An AOE heavy invade based jungle? Seems to me like it would absolutely fuck her.

I don't think the buffs are the correct place to put power into single target junglers because they're such an important thing to secure.
